44.bkm: Ghɨ n-toŋtɨ̂ kɨmɨ ànfyèmtɨ̀ a kòronà nâ kèynà na covid bèŋ 19. A n-ghɨ ìkoʼi ifɨ-i ta yi gvì, fɨsɨ̂  ànfyèmtɨ̀, mɨtì ma yi kù wul sɨ a ŋaŋ, yi kâʼ a yi zue. Yi n-lae fvɨ̀ ilaʼ i Chaynà sɨ asɨ a bêŋ 2019, nà sɨ ghɨ lvɨ̂yn ma yi jelɨ meyn tɨlaʼ a mbzɨ tɨ dvɨ̂ kɨ tèyn. Ghɨ n-kya wi na ikoʼi nâ yènì lù nô wo a.
44.en: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.

45.bkm: Ghɨ n-toŋtɨ̂ kɨmɨ ànfyèmtɨ̀ a kòronà nâ kèynà na covid bèŋ 19. A n-ghɨ ìkoʼi ifɨ-i ta yi gvì, fɨsɨ̂  ànfyèmtɨ̀, mɨtì ma yi kù wul sɨ a ŋaŋ, yi kâʼ a yi zue. 45.en: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.

Yi n-lae fvɨ̀ ilaʼ i Chaynà sɨ asɨ a bêŋ 2019, nà sɨ ghɨ lvɨ̂yn ma yi jelɨ meyn tɨlaʼ a mbzɨ tɨ dvɨ̂ kɨ tèyn. Ghɨ n-kya wi na ikoʼi nâ yènì lù nô wo a.
46.en: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.

55.bkm: Wùl vzɨ̀ a wù sɨ kelɨ ngeʼ a ŋweyn item
55.en: Person with a heart condition or disease

56.bkm: Wùl vzɨ̀ a wù sɨ kelɨ ngeʼ a ŋweyn item
56.en: Person with a heart condition or disease

57.en: People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

58.en: People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

70.bkm: Ikoʼi nâ yèynì nɨn ku wul, wù kâʼ a wù keli ànfyèmtɨ̀, wù kâʼ a wù keli àgvɨl nɨ̀ àkesi-a. A nî a nà ghɨ ɨlvɨ nâ ghè, ma wù kàʼ a wù na ku kɨ ta wù bòl bolɨ. Ɨwuyn ɨ ŋweyn nî wu nà yafɨ kɨ ɨ̀jɨ̀m. A nî a nà ghɨ tì, ma ɨlvâ ɨ ŋweyn kàʼ a wu na chwô, lvɨ fɨli ɨtoŋ ŋweyn ɨ yafa antêynɨ̀. Mɨtì, ghelɨ ghɨli nɨn ghɨ  kɨmɨ ghɨ ma ghɨ kèli ikòʼi ateyn, a ghɨ na ghesî kêʼ kɨ tèyn, afo ali-a dyêyn wì na ghɨ n-kelɨ-a. Ati iwo zɨ̀-ì a wul ɨ̂lvɨ̀ nɨn n-keli, wu lae jèl ɨ to bula wù nyvɨ àfɨ nô sakos.
70.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

71.bkm: Ikoʼi nâ yèynì nɨn ku wul, wù kâʼ a wù keli ànfyèmtɨ̀, wù kâʼ a wù keli àgvɨl nɨ̀ àkesi-a. A nî a nà ghɨ ɨlvɨ nâ ghè, ma wù kàʼ a wù na ku kɨ ta wù bòl bolɨ. Ɨwuyn ɨ ŋweyn nî wu nà yafɨ kɨ ɨ̀jɨ̀m. A nî a nà ghɨ tì, ma ɨlvâ ɨ ŋweyn kàʼ a wu na chwô, lvɨ fɨli ɨtoŋ ŋweyn ɨ yafa antêynɨ̀. Mɨtì, ghelɨ ghɨli nɨn ghɨ  kɨmɨ ghɨ ma ghɨ kèli ikòʼi ateyn, a ghɨ na ghesî kêʼ kɨ tèyn, afo ali-a dyêyn wì na ghɨ n-kelɨ-a. Ati iwo zɨ̀-ì a wul ɨ̂lvɨ̀ nɨn n-keli, wu lae jèl ɨ to bula wù nyvɨ àfɨ nô sakos.
71.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

72.bkm: Ikoʼi nâ yèynì nɨn ku wul, wù kâʼ a wù keli ànfyèmtɨ̀, wù kâʼ a wù keli àgvɨl nɨ̀ àkesi-a. A nî a nà ghɨ ɨlvɨ nâ ghè, ma wù kàʼ a wù na ku kɨ ta wù bòl bolɨ. Ɨwuyn ɨ ŋweyn nî wu nà yafɨ kɨ ɨ̀jɨ̀m. A nî a nà ghɨ tì, ma ɨlvâ ɨ ŋweyn kàʼ a wu na chwô, lvɨ fɨli ɨtoŋ ŋweyn ɨ yafa antêynɨ̀. Mɨtì, ghelɨ ghɨli nɨn ghɨ  kɨmɨ ghɨ ma ghɨ kèli ikòʼi ateyn, a ghɨ na ghesî kêʼ kɨ tèyn, afo ali-a dyêyn wì na ghɨ n-kelɨ-a. Ati iwo zɨ̀-ì a wul ɨ̂lvɨ̀ nɨn n-keli, wu lae jèl ɨ to bula wù nyvɨ àfɨ nô sakos.
72.en: The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

77.bkm: Wùl kae sɨ nà kelɨ ànfyèmtɨ̀ a kòronà ɨ̀ kèsi kèsa wù chèm chem a wa a ngùŋ, fɨlêʼnɨ̀ fɨ mɨ̂nchyafɨ fvɨ̂ a ŋweyn ɨchvɨ̀ kèsa à fvɨ̀ azue ɨ̀ gvì zɨ a wa ɨchvɨ kèsa a wa azue, a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀ dyaŋ. Kɨ kâʼ a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀mɨ sɨ̂ wùl ɨlvɨ ta wù kùm afo, kèsa wù kùm alêʼma wùl ɨ koʼinɨ ni meyn boŋ kùm ɨ̀ fì  kàsî ndù kùm a kɨ ŋweyn azue-a kèsa wù kùm ìsɨ.
77.en: COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

78.bkm: Wùl kae sɨ nà kelɨ ànfyèmtɨ̀ a kòronà ɨ̀ kèsi kèsa wù chèm chem a wa a ngùŋ, fɨlêʼnɨ̀ fɨ mɨ̂nchyafɨ fvɨ̂ a ŋweyn ɨchvɨ̀ kèsa à fvɨ̀ azue ɨ̀ gvì zɨ a wa ɨchvɨ kèsa a wa azue, a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀ dyaŋ. Kɨ kâʼ a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀mɨ sɨ̂ wùl ɨlvɨ ta wù kùm afo, kèsa wù kùm alêʼma wùl ɨ koʼinɨ ni meyn boŋ kùm ɨ̀ fì  kàsî ndù kùm a kɨ ŋweyn azue-a kèsa wù kùm ìsɨ.
78.en: COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

79.bkm: Wùl kae sɨ nà kelɨ ànfyèmtɨ̀ a kòronà ɨ̀ kèsi kèsa wù chèm chem a wa a ngùŋ, fɨlêʼnɨ̀ fɨ mɨ̂nchyafɨ fvɨ̂ a ŋweyn ɨchvɨ̀ kèsa à fvɨ̀ azue ɨ̀ gvì zɨ a wa ɨchvɨ kèsa a wa azue, a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀ dyaŋ. Kɨ kâʼ a kɨ dyaŋ kɨ̀mɨ sɨ̂ wùl ɨlvɨ ta wù kùm afo, kèsa wù kùm alêʼma wùl ɨ koʼinɨ ni meyn boŋ kùm ɨ̀ fì  kàsî ndù kùm a kɨ ŋweyn azue-a kèsa wù kùm ìsɨ.
79.en: COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

88.bkm: Wà kàʼ a wà kɨŋtɨ ti ngêŋ zya a?

89.bkm: Wà kàʼ a wà kɨŋtɨ ti ngêŋ zya a?

95.bkm: 2. Ghesɨ̀nà na sesɨ sù ɨ̀wu, ghɨ nà sû nɨ̀ àsu-a fî teʼa, ghɨ chyatɨ̂ chyàtɨ ghesɨ̀nà. Ghelɨ nɨn sesɨ sù ɨwu akaŋ àmòʼ, ghɨli nà kasi nuʼ kɨ nuʼ ɨwu àŋena. Wa sû ɨwu ɨ̀va, wa yès nɨ̀ abas afo-a kɨ layna.
95.en: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

96.bkm: 2. Ghesɨ̀nà na sesɨ sù ɨ̀wu, ghɨ nà sû nɨ̀ àsu-a fî teʼa, ghɨ chyatɨ̂ chyàtɨ ghesɨ̀nà. Ghelɨ nɨn sesɨ sù ɨwu akaŋ àmòʼ, ghɨli nà kasi nuʼ kɨ nuʼ ɨwu àŋena. Wa sû ɨwu ɨ̀va, wa yès nɨ̀ abas afo-a kɨ layna.
96.en: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

103.en: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.

104.en: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.

118.bkm: 6. Ghesɨ̀nà maʼi awu afunɨ-a sa lvɨ̂yn ɨ̀ nà toŋtɨ̂ kɨ nɨ̀ ɨ̀chvɨ̂. Jisɨ itoŋtɨ sɨ nɨn dvɨ̂ kɨ tèyn.
118.en: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

119.bkm: 6. Ghesɨ̀nà maʼi awu afunɨ-a sa lvɨ̂yn ɨ̀ nà toŋtɨ̂ kɨ nɨ̀ ɨ̀chvɨ̂. Jisɨ itoŋtɨ sɨ nɨn dvɨ̂ kɨ tèyn.
119.en: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

122.bkm: 7. Ka ghesɨ̀nà fɨ̂ dùʼì ɨ̀ yvɨ̀ŋtɨ̀ alêʼ àmòʼ sɨ nà fyes ɨwuyn.

123.bkm: 7. Ka ghesɨ̀nà fɨ̂ dùʼì ɨ̀ yvɨ̀ŋtɨ̀ alêʼ àmòʼ sɨ nà fyes ɨwuyn.

126.bkm: 8. Yi na boynɨ-à, wa nà duʼ kɨ a wa ndo, fvɨ̂ kɨ abe ma à n-lutɨ̂ sû to ìwo.

127.bkm: 8. Yi na boynɨ-à, wa nà duʼ kɨ a wa ndo, fvɨ̂ kɨ abe ma à n-lutɨ̂ sû to ìwo.

130.bkm: 9. Ghesɨ̀nà na faytɨ̂ yvɨtɨ̂ ìtebtɨ zɨ̀-ì a ghɨ n-fu kûm ìkoʼi nâ yènɨ̀, teytɨ̂ màʼì àwo ali-a kì a ghelɨ  ghɨli nɨn bê sɨ ànkaŋ.
130.en: 9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.

131.bkm: 9. Ghesɨ̀nà na faytɨ̂ yvɨtɨ̂ ìtebtɨ zɨ̀-ì a ghɨ n-fu kûm ìkoʼi nâ yènɨ̀, teytɨ̂ màʼì àwo ali-a kì a ghelɨ  ghɨli nɨn bê sɨ ànkaŋ.
131.en: 9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.

132.bkm: Ɨwêyn nɨn ghɨ ɨ̀lwêʼ ɨlvɨ vzɨ̀ a wà kà a wà jaŋ ateyn sɨ keli igyâmtɨ.
132.en: - Call 1510 and follow the doctor's instructions. Other possible numbers:
